gurmukhi: ਕਹਯੋ ਨ ਮੋਰ ਕਾਜ ਹੈ ॥ ਮਿਖਯਾ ੲਿਹ ਤੋਹ ਸਾਜ ਹੈ ॥
transliteration: Kahyo Na Mor Kaaj Hai|| Mithyaa Eh Tor Saaj Hai||
translation: The Brahmin said that all those things were of no use to him and all the ostentations offered by the king were false.

gurmukhi: ਅਢਾੲਿ ਪਾਵ ਭੂੰਮ ਦੈ ॥ ਬਸੇਖ ਪੂਰ ਕੀਰਤ ਲੈ ॥੭॥
transliteration: Adhaae Paav Bhoonm Dai|| Basekh Poor Keerat Lai||7||
translation: He then asked him to give only two and a half steps of the earth; and accept the special eulogy.7.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਦਿਜ ਅੈਸ ਬਖਾਨੀ ਬਾਨੀ ॥ ਭੂਪਤ ਸਹਤ ਨ ਜਾਨਯੋ ਰਾਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Jab Dij Ais Bakhaanibaanee|| Bhoopat Sahat Na Jaanyo Raanee||
translation: When the Brahmin uttered these words, the king along with the queen could not understand its import.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰ ਅਢਾੲਿ ਭੂੰਮ ਦੇ ਕਹੀ ॥ ਦਿੜ ਕਰਿ ਬਾਤ ਦਿਜੋਤਮ ਗਹੀ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Pair Adhaae Bhoonm De Kahee|| Did Kar(i) Baat Dijotam Gadee||8||
translation: That Brahmin again said the same thing with determination that he had asked only for two and a half steps of the earth.8.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਜਬਰ ਸੁਕ੍ਰ ਹੁਤੋ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਤੀਰਾ ॥ ਜਾਨ ਗਯੋ ਸਭ ਭੇਦੁ ਵਜੀਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Dijbar Soukra Houto Nrip Teeraa|| Jaan Gado Sabh Bhed(u) Vajeeraa||
translation: Shukracharya, the preceptor of the king was with him at that time, and he alongwith all the ministers comprehended the mystery of asking only for earth.

gurmukhi: ਜਯੋ ਜਯੋ ਦੇਨ ਪ੍ਰਿਥਵੀ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਕਹੈ ॥ ਤਿਮੁ ਤਿਮੁ ਨਾਹਿ ਪ੍ਰੋਹਤੁ ਗਹੈ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Jyo Jyo Den Prithvinrip Kahai|| Tim(u) Tim(u) Naah(i) Prohat(u) Gadai||9||
translation: As many times the king orders for the donation of the earth, for so many times the preceptor Shukracharya asks him not to agree to it.9.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਦੇਨ ਧਰਾ ਮਨ ਕੀਨਾ ॥ ਤਬ ਹੀ ੳੁੱਤ੍ਰ ਸੁਕ੍ਰ ੲਿਮ ਦੀਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Jab Nrip Den Dharaa Man Keedaa|| Tab Hiouttra Soukra Im Deenaa||
translation: But when the king made up his mind firmly to give the required earth as alms, then Shukracharya giving his reply said this to the king,

gurmukhi: ਲਘੁ ਦਿਜ ਯਾਹਿ ਨ ਭੂਪ ਪਛਾਨੋ ॥ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਵਤਾਰ ੲਿਸੀ ਕਰ ਮਾਨੋ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Laghu Dij Yaah(i) Na Bhoop Pachhaado|| Bisan(u) Vataar Isikar Maano||10||
translation: “O king ! do not consider him a small-sized Brahmin, consider him only as an incarnation of Vishnu.”10.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨਤ ਬਚਨ ਦਾਨਵ ਸਭ ਹਸੇ ॥ ੳੁਚਰਤ ਸੁੱਕ੍ਰ ਕਹਾ ਘਰ ਬਸੇ ॥
transliteration: Sounat Bachannddaanav Sabh Hase|| Ouchrat Soukkra Kahaa Ghar Base||
translation: Hearing this, all the demons laughed and said: “Shukracharya is only thinking of useless thing,”

gurmukhi: ਸਸਿਕ ਸਮਾਨ ਨ ਦਿਜ ਮਹਿ ਮਾਸਾ ॥ ਕਸ ਕਰ ਹੈ ੲਿਹ ਜੱਗ ਬਿਨਾਸਾ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Sasik Samaan Na Dij Maih Maasaa|| Kas Kar Hai Eh Jagg Binaasaa||11||
translation: “The Brahmin, whose body doth not contain the flesh more than a rabbit, how can he destroy the world?”11.
